title: Riot GJ on nerfing the real problem (fervor of battle and rageblade) and not the champions
body:
Now instead of nerfing Brand and Swain directly while also most likely going to nerf the masteries soon too, can you hit the real problem (the mastery)?

Don't understand why you would take two vastly different approaches on a similar problem

Out of curiosity I have to ask what determines to Riot if a champion is overloaded or if its an external factor in a case like this (such as Jax with rageblade, Yasuo with crit changes, Mundo with new defense tree, etc).

Yes, we think they're too strong and have got to the point where, even with mastery changes, we need to trim some power from them.

For champions versus masteries/items/whatever we start with an assessment of how the other element's performing overall. Rageblade for example's definitely too strong on Jax, but it's also just too strong across the board compared to other items. Similarly Warlord's Bloodlust was too strong in general compared to where T3 keystone masteries should be (though it's also possible Yasuo might be too strong as well, still watching that).

>Yes, we think they're too strong and have got to the point where, even with mastery changes, we need to trim some power from them.

Case and point: Twitch was rarely played until his visual update, at which point he saw all kinds of play. Seeing all that play, a lot of people came to the conclusion that he was too strong, and he got some nerfs. Notice that the balance of the champion didn't change between being popular and being unpopular, nor the meta, nor the items if I recall correctly. I suspect Riot has been trying to keep an eye on unpopular champions to see if they're too strong regardless of their popularity, with Swain being just one of them.

Charm's damage amp was not removed due to being too powerful, it was removed because its reason to exist was no longer there after the removal of DFG. The Charm damage amp was put in to balance the assassination potential of DFG Ahri around hitting a difficult skillshot, because prior to that DFG-R-W could 100-0 players and that was ridiculous. While DFG existed, Ahri HAD to be an assassin, so the damage amp on Charm made her a skillful one.

When they removed DFG they knew they could finally push her more into the "mobile mage" direction they'd initially intended for her to have, so the damage amp on Charm was removed to reduce her assassination potential in exchange for improved kiting.

tl;dr the idea that damage amps are inherently problematic or too powerful is ridiculous. Ahri's was removed because it gave her a playstyle that Riot didn't want her to have, while Swain's does no such thing. It's fine.
